page.title: 19LITTLEPORT 60 YEARS AGO
page.content:
The{village}was all fields and a few houses. A farmyard and barn stood next to the church. Gypsies camped along a grassy drove, where the Village College is now. Crown Lane was very narrow with a blacksmith's at the bottom. Audley House stood at the top of Church Lane and the curate lived in the house between the Boys' and Girls' schools.
There was a chaff factory near the station and a mill farther down the road to Black Horse Drove. Barges used to come along the river from Kings Lynn and unload at the{docks. The area known as the Moors used to be flooded and frozen over in the winter and used for{skating}matches as well as along the river. Long skates called fen runners were used and the champion was called Smart.
